identificationModule.briefTitle: Evaluation of Long-Term Gait Development in Infants With Neonatal Encephalopathy Using Infant Treadmill
identificationModule.officialTitle: Evaluation of Long-Term Gait Development in Infants With Neonatal Encephalopathy Using Infant Treadmill

statusModule.whyStopped: The study was concluded as planned upon reaching its predetermined endpoint, which included the completion of data collection and achievement of the necessary sample size for statistical significance.

collaborators.name: Shanghai High-risk Infants Early Intervention Center

descriptionModule.briefSummary: There have been many studies on the use of running training in older children to improve gait development in children with cerebral palsy. The aim of our study was to conduct early treadmill training in infants who were highly suspected of cerebral palsy and to follow up on their long-term gait development.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Parallel Assignment All subjects were divided into two groups: intervention group A (treadmill intervention + routine physical rehabilitation therapy) and positive control group (receiving routine physical rehabilitation therapy only).

armGroups.label: intervention group
armGroups.description: Baby treadmill + conventional physical rehabilitation training

interventions.name: Baby treadmill
interventions.description: The newborns who received treadmill intervention were stimulated by running 3 times a week for a total of 10 minutes each time (complete in 5 cycles, 2 minutes per cycle, 2 minutes after the completion of one cycle and rest for 2 minutes to start the next cycle). Until the completion and completion of the five cycles). During the remaining four days of each week, other physical rehabilitation training is carried out by the rehabilitator in accordance with the established rehabilitation plan. The stimulation of running lasted from 3 months of corrected gestational age to being able to walk alone for 3 steps or to correct for 18 months.

interventions.name: Conventional physical rehabilitation training
interventions.description: Suitable for general physical rehabilitation training of all infants with cerebral palsy.

primaryOutcomes.description: This variable is a number that records the infants' number of coordinated gaits in all gait training processes.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The length of time from birth to the corrected age of 18 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: age of onset of independent walking
primaryOutcomes.description: This variable is a gait parameter, recording a point in time the baby will start walking independently.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The length of time from birth to the corrected age of 2 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: age of onset of walking with assistance
secondaryOutcomes.description: This variable is a gait parameter, recording a point in time the baby will start walking with assistance.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The length of time from birth to the corrected age of 2 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: The length of displacement formed by the same foot after completing a gait.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The length of time from birth to the corrected age of 18 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: The vertical distance between the parallel lines of two medial plantar edges
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The length of time from birth to the corrected age of 18 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of two-limb support gait in the whole training process.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The length of time from birth to the corrected age of 18 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of gait ankle plantar flexion in the whole training process.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The length of time from birth to the corrected age of 18 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of toe-off gait in the whole training process.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The length of time from birth to the corrected age of 18 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of ankle dorsiflexion gait in the whole training process.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The length of time from birth to the corrected age of 18 months
